main event: Two objects emitting spasmodic flashes of light were observed in Atlanta, Georgia on 3 April 1954.
interesting points: The first sighting lasted approximately sixty seconds while the second lasted about ninety seconds., The objects were seen three minutes apart and exhibited erratic movements across the sky., Both objects appeared as stabs of light and darted at high speed., An astronomer reported no astronomical explanation for the sightings., The witnesses included a reliable chemist and another unidentified source.
witness description: Mr. William Lord, a chemist age sixty, and another identified source age fifty-one
